# saveGraphicsState()

**Type Method**

Saves the graphics state of the current graphics context.

## Declaration

```swift
class func saveGraphicsState()
```

## Discussion

This method sends the current graphics context a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext/saveGraphicsState()-swift.method] message and pushes the context onto the per-thread stack.

## Managing the Graphics State

- **restoreGraphicsState()**: Pops a graphics context from the per-thread stack, makes it current, and sends the context a restore graphics state message.
- **restoreGraphicsState()**: Removes the context’s graphics state from the top of the graphics state stack and makes the next graphics state the current graphics state.
- **saveGraphicsState()**: Saves the current graphics state and creates a new graphics state on the top of the stack.
- **setGraphicsState(_:)**: Makes the graphics context of the specified graphics state current, and resets graphics state.
